tutorial.title: Recipe Website
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use images, links, and nested lists to build a simple recipe website

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use our HTML knowledge to create a small recipe website that links to the recipe's ingredients.

We'll start with three html files, one as a home page, containing links for the recipes, and then two distinct ones for each recipe.

The basic HTML code has already been filled in and the style sheet linked, so that elements are styled as soon as you add them. 

Take a look at the code that's already there.

1. `index.html` - Here, we'll add the code needed for the home page
2. `cheesecake.html` - Here, we'll add the code needed for the recipe guide of cheesecake.
3. `dumplings.html` - Here, we'll add the code needed for the recipe guide of dumplings.
4. `style.css` and `style2.css` - These are the style sheets that already have code that will style the elements. We'll learn all about this later.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>
   
  </body>
</html>

files.name: cheesecake.html
files.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link href="style2.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>

  </body>
</html>

files.name: dumplings.html
files.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link href="style2.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>

  </body>
</html>

files.name: style.css
style2.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's start coding the home page since it is the first page that the user will see.

In the preview, we've seen that the homepage has a logo, a search bar, two headings, two images, and two links. 

We'll start by adding the logo, the first heading, and the first image. 

1. Inside `body` , code an image element for the logo. Set the source to `https://mimo.app/i/logo.png`. 
2. Under the logo, code an `h4` element for the heading `FEATURED RECIPE`.
3. Code another image element for the cheesecake under `FEATURED RECIPE`. Set the source path to `https://mimo.app/i/cheesecake.png`.

files.name: index.html
files.content:
<!--index.html-->
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <link href="style.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>
files.solvedContent: FEATURED RECIPE

files.name: cheesecake.html
files.content:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>repl.it</title>
    <link href="style2.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>

  </body>
</html>

style2.css

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
1. Make sure you're *not* using a closing tag for the `img` element.
2. Set the image source using the `src` attribute.

executableContent.instructions:
The website looks good so far, but users need a way to check out the cheesecake recipe.

Let's add a small paragraph that will link to the HTML file of the cheesecake recipe. 

1. Under the last image, code a paragraph element with the text `See Recipe >>>`.
2. Wrap this text with an `a` element inside the paragraph, so that the paragraph's text is between the `a` tags, and link it to the `cheesecake.html` file.

files.name: index.html
files.content: FEATURED RECIPE
files.solvedContent:
FEATURED RECIPE

See Recipe >>>

    <link href="style2.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
  </head>
  <body>

  </body>
</html>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
1. Use the `

` tags to create a paragraph. 2. Use an `href` attribute with the value `"cheesecake.html"` to link to the `cheesecake.html` file. 3. To nest a tag inside another tag, place one element's tags inside the other element. For example:`

See Recipe >>>

`.

executableContent.instructions:
It is time to put the section for the dumplings recipe.

We will add a heading, an image, and a link to the HTML file containing the code for the dumplings recipe.

1. Under the paragraph, code an `h4` element for the heading `OTHER RECIPES`.
2. Code an image element for dumplings. Set the source path to `https://mimo.app/i/dumplings.png`.
3. Under the image, code a paragraph with the text `See Recipe >>>`.
3. Put an `a` element inside the paragraph, so that the paragraph's text is between the `a` tags, and link it to the `dumplings.html` file.

files.content:
FEATURED RECIPE

See Recipe >>>

See Recipe >>>

OTHER RECIPES

See Recipe >>>

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
1. Take a look at how you did the cheesecake part.
2. Make sure to place the `OTHER RECIPES` heading directly under the `See Recipe >>>` paragraph.

executableContent.instructions:
A search bar is important when navigating websites, especially when they host a lot of recipes. Let's add a search bar to our website. 

To add this, we'll need the `input` element, which takes input from the user. 

1. Code an `input` element after the first `img` element.
2. Set the `type` of the `input` element to `text`.
3. Set the `placeholder` attribute to `Look for a recipe`.

OTHER RECIPES

executableContent.instructions:
Currently, our webpage has no sections to divide the cheesecake and the dumplings info. 

Let's use `div` element to divide the page into two sections.

1. Nest the code for the cheesecake section inside the division element.
2. Nest the code for the dumplings section inside another division element.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content:
1. The cheesecake section contains the first `h4` element, as well as the `img` and `p` elements under it. 2. The dumplings section starts with the `

OTHER RECIPES

` and contains the `img` and `p` elements under it. 2. Don't forget that the `div` element has a closing tag.

executableContent.instructions:
Kudos! The home page looks great!

Time to set up the cheesecake recipe page.

1. Inside the body, code an `h1` element for the heading `EASY CHEESECAKE RECIPE`.
2. Underneath, code an image element for the cheesecake image. Set the source to `https://mimo.app/i/cheesecake.png`.

executableContent.instructions:
What is a cheesecake made of? Graham cracker crust and Cheesecake filling!

Let's list both of them in an ordered list.

1. Create an ordered list under the image.
2. Insert two list items - `Graham Cracker Crust` and `Cheesecake Filling`.

executableContent.instructions:
But what is Graham Cracker Crust made of? 

Let's list the ingredients.

1. Code an unordered list inside the ordered list. The list should come after the `Graham Cracker Crust` list item on the page.
2. Insert four list items in the unordered list - `Graham Crackers` , `Butter` , `Sugar` , and `Salt`.

    ```

executableContent.instructions:
Next, let's do the same for the Cheesecake Filling.

1. Code an unordered list inside the ordered list, right under the `Cheesecake Filling` item.
2. Insert five list items in the unordered list - `Cream Cheese`, `Sugar`, `Sour Cream`, `Vanilla Extract`, and `Eggs`.

Now, for the dumplings part, let's follow the same steps.

1. Code an `h1` element for the heading `EASY DUMPLINGS RECIPE`.
2. Code an image element for the dumplings image. Set the source to `https://mimo.app/i/dumplings.png`.

executableContent.instructions:
For the dumplings recipe, we need dumplings and a dipping sauce to complement it. 

Let's start with an ordered list, like in the cheesecake code.

1. Create an ordered list under the image.
2. Insert two list items - `Dumplings` and `Dipping Sauce`.

executableContent.instructions:
Dumplings require a lot of ingredients. 

Hence, we will list them in an unordered list.

1. Code an unordered list inside the ordered list. The list should come after `Dumplings` on the page.
2. Insert seven list items in the unordered list - `Flour` , `Salt` , `Warm Water` , `Red Cabbage` , `Green Onions` , `Garlic and Ginger` and `Soy Sauce`.
